title: setting Hot Keys
content: Earlier versions of Windows/Firefox allowed for the setting of Hot Keys for performing particular actions and Windows Ten does not allow for this feature. How can I now set a 'hot key' or toggle to a webpage full screen that covers the several Task Bars of my usual screen set up? Tks
creator: hulsedennis

title: Constant crashes even after creating new profile
content:
I've been using FF for quite some time. Until it started crashing tabs constantly, even just after opening a new tab. I tried disable extensions, but didn't fix it. Then I created a fresh new profile and just used sync. Same results. Chkdsk is fine, no malware. I don't know what else to try.

Windows 10 21H2

Here are the last 2 log IDs:

b0e64f21-f625-4854-b855-20406a47906f dc28686d-1a32-4586-87ca-c056cccc2562 dd8d5ef4-3399-454a-b229-7cdf1e997bd6 37f98890-17fa-4611-8ebf-0d30b7acdaa3 02a3ef86-c0e6-4ebc-a7a3-7204f2452e23
creator: dexter.progressive.metal

title: Firefox
content:
Hi,

I'm recently encountering a problem of Google icon appearing search field of FF browser despite that I set FF as default. Had twice uninstalled/reinstalled it but it nevertheless always reappears. Don't want to have anything to do with Google. Your help will be highly appreciated. Thanks.

Brgds, Alojz Kajtna
creator: alojzkajtna335

title: Opening a new tab while in full screen problem
content:
So, I've noticed that if I open a new tab while in full screen (ex: watching a youtube video in full screen) it doesn't automatically select the search bar for me to type in. I know this is a very minor problem, but it really bugs me. Can this be changed from preferences or any other way? Thanks in Advance

Edit: I copied this issue from someone who already raised because this exact thing annoys me too even if it's small one. Is there any solution to this problem?
creator: isamamedov95

title: Lost previous session & history not showing visited tabs - only closed ones
content:
Firefox has a frustrating habit of closing windows and not restoring them properly. I had 2 windows with a multiple tabs open in each and Firefox will successfully reopen both windows until it doesn't. I tried all the methods with going into history or using the previous.json file in sessionrestore-backups but that file only had 1 window. Now I'm trying to use my browser history to see which websites I visited but all that shows up are the closed tabs - not the windows or the websites I was on before the tab was closed.

Where can I find full browsing information to restore my lost tabs? Alternatively I heard before Firefox updates it creates a snapshot of tabs/windows. How can I access this as a backup?

I dislike Chrome, but it honestly is much better at saving previous sessions.
creator: bonetfreedle

title: Stop new tabs from being focused
content:
On some websites (namely, twitter), middle clicking a post opens it in a new tab. However, whenever this happens, the new tab is always focused, is there a way to prevent this from happening?

This does not occur on websites such as Youtube.com, where middle clicking a video opens it in a new tab, but does not focus it. This is the preferred result.

Likewise, when middle clicking a bookmark, the newly created tab is also immediately focused. Is this preventable aswell?

Thank you for your time.
creator: suliman_H

title: Download action changeing by itself
content: For some reason my default PDF reader keeps being changed to MS Office instead of just opening them in the browser as I directed. I keep having to change the setting in Firefox every couple of weeks (general > applications > PDF). What's causing this?
creator: kinglumus1

title: Bookmark icons defaulting to top of Notion pages - not icon for page I want to bookmark
content:
I use and love Notion notes app - and have whole personal wiki's on various enormous subjects for my blogging. EG: I have a Greenie page with a tree icon - a Space page with a Rocket icon - and a home renovation page with a hammer icon. I'm a bit OCD about using the bookmarks toolbar with tiny icons and no text labels for efficiency. Icons are important to me.

In Chrome I can just drag any Notion page and the icon for that page works! Tree, Rocket, Hammer - they're all there.

But the problem is in FF it only drags down hammers. I think it is something to do with the fact that my home renovation page with the hammer is the TOP PAGE - and FF seems to think the icon for that is the icon for the whole website I use? The icon should be enough - I shouldn't have to write text to explain what a page is. But in FF - I can't have 20 something Notion icons. I just get hammers. Any ideas?
creator: eclipsenow1

title: Firefox does not detect Apple GPU which limits Max Texture Size
content: I have a problem where certain images do not load on my Macbook M1 laptop. When I run the WebGL test at https://webglreport.com/?v=2 on Firefox I get a max texture size of 8192 and Apple M1 as the GPU and renderer, while on Safari and all other browsers I get a max texture size of 16382 with Apple GPU and WebGL as the renderer. I have already set layers.acceleration.force-enabled to True and restarted Firefox. The same image loads on a Windows machine where I set the same variable. Is there a reason this is does not work on Firefox?
creator: ebreiss

title: Twitch video player
content: I'm currently experiencing difficulties with the Twitch video player. After typing a message of a certain length, between 3-4 lines, the video player starts moving back and forth in time with the cursor and stops when the cursor stops. I have no idea what causes it. I've turned off all my addons, reset Firefox, and messed around with settings. the only thing that stops it is running troubleshoot mode, but i don't know what is being changed to fix the issue.
creator: igodin

title: private browsing by default
content:
Hi- I'd like to have every single tab open as private, whether I open it manually or click on a link that opens in a new tab. How do I do that? I never want any tab to open as anything other than private.

Thanks
creator: dfosterpta

title: Videos auto-play (video AND audio) despite Block setting being on for both
content:
Going to any page on the ESPN.com site, videos are playing automatically - both video and audio - despite the fact that I have Firefox set to block both.

I am running Firefox 104.0.2 (latest version) on Windows 10.

Seems like the blocker is missing something, somehow. Anyone else see this?
creator: cassidy.mt

title: Password syncing
content:
A sync was forced and now my account has been disconnected. With it went my passwords. I cannot access my passwords because I don't recall my password. If I initiate a password change then, as the image warns, I may lose some, possibly of my passwords, etc. (Note: I did not have a master password setup).

If I wanted my browsers synced then I would have. To force me to sync is poor business practice. It's like going to McDonald's and ordering black coffee and what you get in black with sugar.

Now, before I leap to, gawd forbid, G___, what do you suggest I do??

Lastly, let me say that I don't understand why password syncing is supposed to allow a SSO across all Mozilla accounts. I'm signed in to Mozilla support, but then I'm not permitted to sign-in to my FF account. Unless you're going to tell me that Mozilla Support is in no way associated with FF, the rationale behind a SSO needs to change.
creator: ca_cleveland
